sentence: Avon Products Inc.AVP is slated to report fourth-quarter 2015 results on Feb 11, 2016, before the opening bell.
Last quarter, the company had delivered a negative earnings surprise of 257.1%.
Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.
Avon continued with its dismal earnings trend as the third quarter of 2015 was again impacted by the ongoing pressures from a volatile currency backdrop and a tough macroeconomic environment.
Further, the company expects the persistence of currency headwinds and impact from its newly effective incremental VAT taxes in Brazil to hurt results in the fourth quarter as well.
This raises our concern about the upcoming results.

However, as a ray of hope in this difficult environment, Avon recently penned a deal with New York-based private investment firm - Cerberus Capital Management to divest 80.1% stake in Avon North America for an equity investment worth $170 million.
As part of this, Avon North America will be separated from Avon Products into a privately held business spanning the U.S., Canada, and Puerto Rico.
The move reflects Avon's attempts to revive its North American operations, increase focus on global markets and generate long-term value for its stockholders.
Also, the global beauty retailer has signed up leading technology firm, Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company to enhance its international IT infrastructure.
Per the deal, Avon will leverage Hewlett Packard's integrated structure to standardize its IT processes, enabling the former to deliver superior quality services of global standards.
Hewlett Packard will enhance Avon's cost structure by identifying the latter's cost efficiencies and lending it tools to work in a more consistent manner.
This will help Avon to seamlessly transform itself according to the ever-changing business needs.
However, these efforts to make a comeback will take time to bear fruit and hardly have any impact on the company's fourth-quarter results.
Our proven model does not conclusively show that Avon is likely to beat earnings this quarter.
This is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #1, 2 or 3 for this to happen.

This is not the case here, as you will see below:

Zacks ESP: Earnings ESP for Avon is +12.50%.
This is because the Most Accurate estimate of 9 cents is above the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 8 cents.
Zacks Rank: Avon carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell).
We caution against stocks with a Zacks Rank #4 or 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company is seeing negative estimate revisions.

Here are some companies you may want to consider as our model shows that these have the right combination of elements to post an earnings beat this quarter:

Lowe's Companies Inc. LOW has an Earnings ESP of +5.09% and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Dean Foods Company DF has an Earnings ESP of +5.88% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Home Depot Inc. HD has an Earnings ESP of +0.91% and a Zacks Rank #3.
